summary: This document is a chain of emails from February 2020 between members of a law enforcement task force, discussing travel logistics for an upcoming trip to Los Angeles to conduct interviews related to the Epstein investigation. The emails focus on hotel bookings, per diem rates, and approval for the trip.

persons.name: S C
persons.context: Appears to be a member of the NYPD/FBI Child Exploitation Human Trafficking Task Force who is requesting and coordinating travel approval and hotel bookings for the team's trip to Los Angeles for Epstein investigation interviews.

events.title: Planned Travel for Epstein Investigation Interviews
events.description: The law enforcement team received approval to travel to Los Angeles during this period to conduct multiple interviews related to the Epstein investigation.

keyFacts: Law enforcement from the NYPD/FBI Child Exploitation Human Trafficking Task Force were traveling to Los Angeles in February 2020 to conduct interviews for the Epstein investigation.
The travel was approved under the same prior request reference number: 2018R01618.
The team planned to conduct interviews on February 26, 27, and 28, 2020.
Hotel logistics were a primary concern, with a member booking the Beverly Hilton due to its government rate, location near attorneys' offices, and to avoid construction noise.
The email chain demonstrates ongoing investigative activity related to the Epstein case in early 2020, focusing on witness interviews.
